parse.title: List of the last monarchs in Europe

text.*:
This article does not cite any sources. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (December 2017) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

This is a list of last monarchs of Europe.

Nation / territory Monarch Title Birth Ruled from Rule Ceased Reason Death Arms
Albania Victor Emmanuel III King of Albania 11 November 1869 16 April 1939 3 September 1943 Armistice of Cassibile 28 December 1947
Austria Charles I Emperor of Austria 17 August 1887 21 November 1916 12 November 1918 Parliament passed the Habsburg Law 1 April 1922
Bulgaria Simeon II Tsar of Bulgaria 16 June 1937 28 August 1943 15 September 1946 Republican constitution adopted
(Referendum) 		living
Croatia Tomislav II King of Croatia 9 March 1900 18 May 1941 31 July 1943 Abdicated 29 January 1948
Czechia Charles III King of Bohemia 17 August 1887 21 November 1916 28 October 1918 Proclamation of the First Czechoslovak Republic 1 April 1922
Finland Nicholas II Grand Duke of Finland 18 May 1868 1 November 1894 15 March 1917 Abdicated 17 July 1918
France Napoleon III Emperor of the French 20 April 1808 2 December 1852 4 September 1870 Abdicated 9 January 1873
Germany
Prussia 		Wilhelm II Emperor of Germany and
King of Prussia 		27 January 1859 15 June 1888 28 November 1918 Abdicated 9 June 1941
Greece Constantine II King of the Hellenes 2 June 1940 6 March 1964 1 June 1973 Deposed living
 Hungary Charles IV King of Hungary 17 August 1887 21 November 1916 16 November 1918 Abdicated 1 April 1922
Iceland Christian X King of Iceland 26 September 1870 14 May 1912 17 June 1944 Republican constitution adopted
(Referendum) 		20 April 1947
Ireland George VI King of Great Britain, Ireland and the British Dominions beyond the Seas 14 December 1895 11 December 1936 29 December 1937 Constitution of Ireland 6 February 1952
Italy Umberto II King of Italy 15 September 1904 9 May 1946 18 June 1946 Republican constitution adopted
(Referendum) 		18 March 1983
Malta Elizabeth II Queen of Malta 21 April 1926 6 February 1952 13 December 1974 Republican constitution adopted living
Montenegro Nicholas I King of Montenegro 7 October 1841 28 August 1910 26 November 1918 Monarchy abolished by the Podgorica Assembly 1 March 1921
Portugal Manuel II King of Portugal and the Algarves 15 November 1889 1 February 1908 5 October 1910 Abdicated 2 July 1932
Romania Michael I King of the Romanians 25 October 1921 6 September 1940 30 December 1947 Monarchy abolished by the Communist government 5 December 2017
Russia Nicholas II Emperor and Autocrat of All the Russia 18 May 1868 1 November 1894 15 March 1917 Abdicated 17 July 1918
Serbia Peter I King of Serbia 11 July 1844 15 June 1903 1 December 1918 merged with Montenegro 16 August 1921
Yugoslavia Peter II King of Yugoslavia 6 September 1923 9 October 1934 29 November 1945 Deposed 3 November 1970

See also[edit]

  • Monarchies in Europe
